Thanks for the detailed instruction uploader. One Q: I use VLC. You know if this will play?

VLC works most of the time but its like a Fisher Price toy when it comes to usability. (does not support everything either) MPC has a simple consistent GUI but is more robust. Once you learn MPC you'll never use anything else. Some say nothings been done with it for years, I say its hard to improve perfection. You simply update the codecs, not the player. I have personally used MPC in Win2000, WinXP, Vista, & Win7. It is a routine install for every computer I work on and it opens faster than other media players, especially on older machines.

Timbermaniac that was probably a raw dvd. Which means it was probably interlaced as well.

veefeld, yes, thats why it says softsubs in the description. Meaning they aren't hard encoded into the video. Right click the codec icon on the right side of the taskbar and select "no subs" or whatever...
